item.title: tweaked build script
putting gohugo output in source control
item.description: 09:01 Sunday 04 December 2016 JST I think this is the short version of what I ended up doing: On server: cd /var/www/public git init git add . git commit -m "website now in version control" git config receive.denyCurrentBranch updateInstead On local: cd ~/gohugo/ rm -rf public/ git clone remote:/var/www/public public Rebuild site with Hugo cd public git add . git commit -m "Changes from local" git push origin master
